intro: Conospermum suaveolensis, commonly known as the sweet-scented conospermum, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, woolly leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal scrub. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
